title: Israel Defends Strike On Gaza Despite Ceasefire Deal With Hamas | 10 News
description: Benjamin Netanyahu has stated that Israel will maintain control over which countries are involved in Gaza security arrangements as a ceasefire remains tentatively in place. He's also made it clear that, despite the involvement of the US in recent negotiations, Israel will answer to no one when it comes to striking their enemies. title: Oscar Piastri Loses Formula 1 Lead For First Time Since April | 10 News
description: Oscar Piastri says he’s been forced to change his driving style to suit his McLaren, but hasn’t lost faith in his ability. The Aussie has lost his Formula 1 championship lead for the first time since April. Lando Norris is now one point clear after winning the Mexican Grand Prix. title: Is The Secret Code Meant To Keep Women Safe At Bars Actually Working? | 10 News+
description: ‘Ask For Angela’ is a discreet code meant for women to use at venues to ask a worker for help if they are stuck in an unsafe or uncomfortable situation. The campaign launched in Australia in 2018, but some critics are calling the rollout “half-baked”. 10 News+ reporter Claudia Vrdoljak talks to advocates and sexual assault survivors about the scheme. title: 'Ask For Angela' Women's Safety Initiative, Barnaby Joyce Chaos, Shania Twain Interview | 10 News+
description: ‘Ask For Angelia’ is a discreet code meant for women to use at venues to ask a worker for help if they are stuck in an unsafe or uncomfortable situation. The campaign launched in Australia in 2018, but some critics are calling the rollout “half-baked”.  Barnaby Joyce is causing chaos in Canberra, leaving fellow politicians and the media confused about his future. Joyce, who is a Nationals MP on the backbench, says he will boycott Nationals party room meetings over their net zero policy, but will still sit with his colleagues during Question Time. He previously announced he won’t recontest his seat at the next election, but refuses to say what his political future holds. Network Political Editor Ashleigh Raper breaks down the situation.  Entertainment Editor Angela Bishop spoke to Shania Twain on the set of a new Uber advertisement featuring the ‘Queen of Country Pop’. Twain has teamed up with Aussie comedian and TikTok star Tom Cardy for the ad campaign, which celebrates the freedom and joy of being an Uber passenger. title: Australian Creative Industries’ Big Triumph Over Artificial Intelligence Companies | 10 News+
description: Australian songwriters and authors are celebrating their win over big tech today, after the government ruled out giving artificial intelligence companies exemptions to Australian copyright rules. Annabelle Herd from the Australian Recording Industry Association speaks to 10 News+ about this landmark decision. title: Russia Test Nuclear Power Missile Described As A ‘Flying Chernobyl’ | 10 News
description: Russia has test fired a nuclear powered missile - that has been likened to a 'tiny flying Chernobyl.  Vladimir Putin announced Russia had successfully fired it's Burevestnik missile - with it covering 14,000 kilometres in several hours of flight, and conducting both horizontal and vertical maneuvers, designed to evade air defence systems. title: Trump Again Refuses To Rule Out Third Presidential Run | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has once again refused to categorically rule out attempting to run for a third presidential term, further stoking rising fears he may try to subvert the US constitution.  The constitution's 22nd amendment prevents anyone from being elected to the office of president more than twice. However, this hasn't stopped rampant speculation that Trump will mount a move to either remain in office in 2028, or find a legal workaround to permit a third tilt at the presidency.  Speaking aboard Air Force One, Trump was asked point-blank if he would rule out a third run. "Am I ruling it out? You tell me," he responded. Trump did, however, address one popularly held theory that he could run as Vice President behind JD Vance, with Vance immediately stepping down after winning an election. Despite that too being constitutionally forbidden, Trump said he would not do it because "it's too cute." title: Hurricane Melissa Slams Jamaica As Category 5 Storm Leaves Trail Of Death Across Caribbean | 10 News
description: Hurricane Melissa has been upgraded to a Category 5 system, the highest level on the Saffir-Simpson scale, with sustained winds reaching 265 kilometres an hour.  The monster storm has begun pounding Jamaica with fierce winds and torrential rain, prompting mandatory evacuations along the coast and fears of catastrophic damage.  At least six people have been killed across the northern Caribbean, including three in Haiti and one in the Dominican Republic, as Melissa tracks toward Cuba and the Bahamas.  Forecasters warn of extensive infrastructure destruction, prolonged power outages and up to 300 millimetres of rain when the storm hits Cuba late Wednesday. title: King Charles Heckled Over Prince Andrew’s Ties To Epstein Outside Cathedral | 10 News
description: King Charles was heckled by a protester over Prince Andrew’s ties to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein when greeting royal fans outside Lichfield Cathedral in north-west England. "How long have you known about Andrew and Epstein?" the man could be heard shouting at the monarch.  “Have you asked the police to cover up for Andrew, Sir?"  Although Prince Andrew recently said that he would give up using his title of Duke of York after years of scrutiny over his behaviour and connections to Epstein, questions about him and what the royals knew of events have grown.  Virginia Giuffre’s memoir, in which she accused the prince of sexually abusing her as a teenager, has added fuel to the fire.  The prince has always denied her account.  The monarch paid no attention to the protester and carried on engaging with other members of the public.
